org.dcm4che.io

Class DicomInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • java.io.FilterInputStream
        • org.dcm4che.io.DicomInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, DicomInputHandler

    public class DicomInputStream
extends FilterInputStream
implements DicomInputHandler
    Reads Dicom attributes from a file.
    Author:
    Gunter Zeilinger

      • defaultBulkData

      • getAllocateLimit

        public final int getAllocateLimit()
        Returns the limit of initial allocated memory for element values. By default, the limit is set to 67108864 (64 MiB).
        Returns:
        Limit of initial allocated memory for value or -1 for no limit
        See Also:
        setAllocateLimit(int)

      • setAllocateLimit

        public final void setAllocateLimit(int allocateLimit)
        Sets the limit of initial allocated memory for element values. If the value length exceeds the limit, a byte array with the specified size is allocated. If the array can filled with bytes read from this DicomInputStream, the byte array is reallocated with twice the previous length and filled again. That continues until the twice of the previous length exceeds the actual value length. Then the byte array is reallocated with actual value length and filled with the remaining bytes for the value from this DicomInputStream. The rational of the incrementing allocation of byte arrays is to avoid OutOfMemoryErrors on parsing corrupted DICOM streams. By default, the limit is set to 67108864 (64 MiB).
        Parameters:
        allocateLimit - limit of initial allocated memory or -1 for no limit

      • readDataset

        public Attributes readDataset(int len,
                     int stopTag)
                       throws IOException
        Creates an Attributes object by reading from a file.
        Parameters:
        len - maximum number of bytes to be read - a value of -1 indicates that that there is no maximum length
        stopTag - value for the tag that will halt reading of the file - a value of -1 indicates that there is no tag that will halt reading
        Returns:
        Attributes object containing the contents of the dataset
        Throws:
        IOException
